You are given a rooted tree with $n$ vertices. Each vertex has a number written on it.  Each edge also has a number written on it.  

A vertex is considered "sad" if there is another vertex in its subtree where the distance between them is greater than the number written on that vertex. The distance between two vertices is the sum of the numbers on the edges along the path connecting them.

You can remove leaves (vertices connected to only one other vertex) from the tree. What is the minimum number of leaves you need to remove so that no vertex in the tree is sad?

You are given a tree with numbers on each node and edge.  A node is "sad" if there is a descendant node with a distance greater than the number on that descendant node.  Find the minimum number of leaf nodes you must remove to make the tree have no sad nodes.
